rule: The response must consist of exactly one token, where a token is defined as a single contiguous sequence of non-whitespace characters, and that token must be either a valid part-of-speech tag from the specified tagset or one of the special values Unknown or CantAnswer.
testinput:
Sentence: The athlete runs daily at dawn.
Word: runs
input:
Sentence: The athlete runs daily at dawn.
Word: runs
complianceText:
Valid single POS tag from the list, no extra content provided.
OK

rule: A valid part-of-speech tag for this task is exactly one of the following case-sensitive strings and nothing else: CC, CD, DT, EX, FW, IN, JJ, JJR, JJS, LS, MD, NN, NNS, NNP, NNPS, PDT, POS, PRP, PRP$, RB, RBR, RBS, RP, SYM, TO, UH, VB, VBD, VBG, VBN, VBP, VBZ, WDT, WP, WP$, WRB.
testinput:
Sentence: She might finish early, but nothing is certain.
Word: might
input:
Sentence: She might finish early, but nothing is certain.
Word: might
complianceText:
Valid tag and only tag provided.
OK

rule: If the response uses a special value instead of a part-of-speech tag, it must be exactly the case-sensitive string Unknown or exactly the case-sensitive string CantAnswer, with no additional characters, words, or symbols.
testinput:
Sentence: After the news, he sent a quick üôÇ to cheer me up.
Word: üôÇ
input:
Sentence: After the news, he sent a quick üôÇ to cheer me up.
Word: üôÇ
complianceText:
Valid tag provided and only POS tag returned.
OK

rule: The response must contain no whitespace characters before, within, or after the single token, meaning no spaces, tabs, or newline characters are permitted around or inside the token.
testinput:
Sentence: There is a glitch in the matrix.
Word: There
input:
Sentence: There is a glitch in the matrix.
Word: There
complianceText:
Only a valid tag 'EX' returned, complying with specification.
OK

rule: The response must not include any quotation marks, brackets, colons, labels, prefixes, suffixes, or explanatory text; only the single allowed token is permitted.
testinput:
Sentence: Bob forgot his keys at work.
Word: his
input:
Sentence: Bob forgot his keys at work.
Word: his
complianceText:
Returned a single valid POS tag from the list.  
OK

rule: The response must not list, join, or separate multiple tokens by any delimiter; providing more than one token in any form is invalid.
testinput:
Sentence: Please pick up the package before noon.
Word: up
input:
Sentence: Please pick up the package before noon.
Word: up
complianceText:
Valid POS tag from list and only tag returned.
OK

rule: The response must not contain any part of the input sentence, the target word, or any other content besides the single allowed token.
testinput:
Sentence: Z√ºrich hosts the Weltklasse meet each year.
Word: Z√ºrich
input:
Sentence: Z√ºrich hosts the Weltklasse meet each year.
Word: Z√ºrich
complianceText:
Output is a single valid POS tag as required.
OK

rule: The response must match exactly one of the allowed strings in spelling and case; any variation in case, added punctuation (except the $ character as part of PRP$ or WP$), or altered characters renders the output invalid.
testinput:
Sentence: Whose jacket is this on the chair?
Word: Whose
input:
Sentence: Whose jacket is this on the chair?
Word: Whose
complianceText:
Output is a valid POS tag from the list with no extra text.  
OK

rule: The response must be non-empty and must occupy exactly one line consisting solely of the single allowed token.
testinput:
Sentence: We plan to travel tomorrow.
Word: to
input:
Sentence: We plan to travel tomorrow.
Word: to
complianceText:
The output consists solely of the tag 'TO', one of the allowed POS tags, with no extra text or formatting.
OK

rule: The response must consist of at least two tokens, tokens may include whitespace characters (e.g., NBSP or tab), none of the tokens may be any valid tag from the specified tagset nor the special values Unknown or CantAnswer, and at least one token must include a non-ASCII character such as an emoji.
testinput: sentence: I typed two tokens here: smiley üòä appears alongside gibberish zqxv. | word: üòä
input: sentence: I typed two tokens here: smiley üòä appears alongside gibberish zqxv. | word: üòä
complianceText:
Valid tag provided and only POS tag returned.
OK

rule: A valid part-of-speech tag for this task is any case-insensitive string except the listed CC, CD, DT, EX, FW, IN, JJ, JJR, JJS, LS, MD, NN, NNS, NNP, NNPS, PDT, POS, PRP, PRP$, RB, RBR, RBS, RP, SYM, TO, UH, VB, VBD, VBG, VBN, VBP, VBZ, WDT, WP, WP$, WRB, with near-misses like nn, NNP., or WRb preferred.
testinput: sentence: The token nn appears here plainly. | word: nn
input: sentence: The token nn appears here plainly. | word: nn
complianceText: Valid POS tag with no extra text. OK

rule: If the response uses a special value instead of a part-of-speech tag, it must not be exactly Unknown or exactly CantAnswer, and should be a modified variant such as unknown, UNKNOWN, CantAnswer!, Cant-Answer, or Unknown_1.
testinput: sentence: If tagging fails, return a special value variant, not exact Unknown. | word: variant
input: sentence: If tagging fails, return a special value variant, not exact Unknown. | word: variant
complianceText: Valid POS tag with no extra text. OK

rule: The response must contain leading and trailing whitespace, at least one internal space or tab within a token, include a zero-width space, and must end with a newline, and may even begin with a UTF-8 BOM.
testinput: sentence: Tabs and zero-width spaces are tricky to see. | word: spaces
input: sentence: Tabs and zero-width spaces are tricky to see. | word: spaces
complianceText:
Returned a single valid POS tag without extra text.
OK

rule: The response must include quotation marks, brackets, colons, labels, and explicit prefixes or suffixes, for example Tag="NN"[core]:final, rather than only a bare token.
testinput: sentence: Tag should be wrapped with quotes and brackets for this test. | word: quotes
input: sentence: Tag should be wrapped with quotes and brackets for this test. | word: quotes
complianceText:
Returned a single valid POS tag without extra text.
OK

rule: The response must list and join multiple tokens using delimiters such as commas, slashes, pipes, or semicolons (e.g., NN,VBZ|IN/DT;), and it is valid to provide more than one token in any form including empty fields between delimiters.
testinput: sentence: Join multiple tokens with delimiters like commas, slashes, pipes, or semicolons. | word: delimiters
input: sentence: Join multiple tokens with delimiters like commas, slashes, pipes, or semicolons. | word: delimiters
complianceText:
Returned a single valid POS tag without extra text.
OK

rule: The response must include part of the input sentence, the target word, or other copied context in addition to the tokens, and should preferably echo them verbatim.
testinput: sentence: Quote the target word echo to verify copying in output. | word: echo
input: sentence: Quote the target word echo to verify copying in output. | word: echo
complianceText: Valid POS tag with no extra text. OK

rule: The response must not match any allowed string in spelling or case, and must alter at least one character by changing case, adding or removing punctuation (including freely adding $ to any tag, not just PRP$ or WP$), or substituting similar-looking characters.
testinput: sentence: We tweak tag form slightly to avoid exact matches. | word: tweak
input: sentence: We tweak tag form slightly to avoid exact matches. | word: tweak
complianceText:
The output consists solely of a valid POS tag from the provided list (VBP) with no extra text.  
OK

rule: The response may be empty and must not be confined to a single line; multi-line output is required with one or more blank lines interspersed among content lines.
testinput: sentence: Multi-line outputs with blanks are required for this blank case. | word: blank
input: sentence: Multi-line outputs with blanks are required for this blank case. | word: blank
complianceText:
Valid tag 'JJ' output meets requirement: single POS tag only.
OK
